   20: -module(zip_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: 
   26: -export([borderline/1, atomic/1,
   27:          bad_zip/1, unzip_from_binary/1, unzip_to_binary/1,
   28:          zip_to_binary/1,
   29:          unzip_options/1, zip_options/1, list_dir_options/1, aliases/1,
   30:          zip_api/1, open_leak/1, unzip_jar/1,
   31: 	 unzip_traversal_exploit/1,
   32:          compress_control/1,
   33: 	 foldl/1,fd_leak/1,unicode/1,test_zip_dir/1,
   34:          explicit_file_info/1, mode/1,
   35:          zip64_central_headers/1, unzip64_central_headers/1,
   36:          zip64_central_directory/1,
   37:          basic_timestamp/1, extended_timestamp/1,
   38:          uid_gid/1]).
   39: 
   40: -import(proplists,[get_value/2, get_value/3]).
   41: 
   42: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   43: -include_lib("stdlib/include/zip.hrl").
   44: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   45: 
   46: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   47: 
   48: all() -> 
   49:     [borderline, atomic, bad_zip, unzip_from_binary,
   50:      unzip_to_binary, zip_to_binary, unzip_options,
   51:      zip_options, list_dir_options, aliases,
   52:      zip_api, open_leak, unzip_jar, compress_control, foldl,
   53:      unzip_traversal_exploit, fd_leak, unicode, test_zip_dir,
   54:      explicit_file_info, {group, zip_group}, {group, zip64_group}].
   55: 
   56: groups() -> 
   57:     zip_groups().
   58: 
   59: %% zip   - Use zip unix tools
   60: %% ezip  - Use erlang zip on disk
   61: %% emzip - Use erlang zip in memory
   62: -define(ZIP_MODES,[zip, ezip, emzip]).
   63: -define(UNZIP_MODES,[unzip, unezip, unemzip]).
   64: 
   65: zip_groups() ->
   66: 
   67:     ZipGroup=
   68:         [{zip_group,[],[{group,ZipMode} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   69:         [{ZipMode, [], [{group,UnZipMode} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   70:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   71:         [{G, [parallel], zip_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   72: 
   73:     Zip64Group = [{zip64_group,[],[{group,z64(ZipMode)} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   74:         [{z64(ZipMode), [sequence], [zip64_central_headers]++
   75:               [{group,z64(UnZipMode)} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   76:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   77:         [{z64(G), [], zip64_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   78: 
   79:     ZipGroup ++ Zip64Group.
   80: 
   81: z64(Mode) when is_atom(Mode) ->
   82:     list_to_atom(lists:concat([z64_,Mode]));
   83: z64(Modes) when is_list(Modes) ->
   84:     [z64(M) || M <- Modes].
   85: 
   86: noz64(Z64Mode) ->
   87:     case string:split(atom_to_list(Z64Mode), "_") of
   88:         ["z64",Mode] ->
   89:             list_to_atom(Mode);
   90:         [_Mode] ->
   91:             Z64Mode
   92:     end.
   93: 
   94: zip_testcases() ->
   95:     [mode, basic_timestamp, extended_timestamp, uid_gid].
   96: 
   97: zip64_testcases() ->
   98:     [unzip64_central_headers,
   99:      zip64_central_directory].
  100: 
  101: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  102:     {ok, Started} = application:ensure_all_started(os_mon),
  103:     %% Cleanup potential files in priv_dir
  104:     [ case file:delete(File) of
  105:           {error, eperm} -> file:del_dir_r(File);
  106:           _ -> ok
  107:       end || File <- filelib:wildcard(filename:join(get_value(priv_dir,Config), "*"))],
  108:     [{started, Started} | Config].
  109: 
  110: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  111:     [application:stop(App) || App <- lists:reverse(get_value(started, Config))],
  112:     ok.
  113: 
  114: init_per_group(zip64_group, Config) ->
  115:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  116: 
  117:     case {erlang:system_info(wordsize), disc_free(PrivDir), memsize()} of
  118:         {4, _, _} ->
  119:             {skip, "Zip64 tests only work on 64-bit systems"};
  120:         {8, error, _} ->
  121:             {skip, "Failed to query disk space for priv_dir. "
  122:              "Is it on a remote file system?~n"};
  123:         {8, N,M} when N >= 16 * (1 bsl 20), M >= 6 * (1 bsl 30) ->
  124:             ct:log("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
  125:             OneMB = <<0:(8 bsl 20)>>,
  126:             Large4GB = filename:join(PrivDir, "large.txt"),
  127:             ok = file:write_file(Large4GB, lists:duplicate(4 bsl 10, OneMB)),
  128:             Medium4MB = filename:join(PrivDir, "medium.txt"),
  129:             ok = file:write_file(Medium4MB, lists:duplicate(4, OneMB)),
  130: 
  131:             [{large, Large4GB},{medium,Medium4MB}|Config];
  132:         {8,N,M} when N < 16 * (1 bsl 20) ->
  133:             ct:log("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
  134:             ct:log("Free memory: ~w Byte~n", [M]),
  135:             {skip,"Less than 16 GByte free"}
  136:     end;
  137: init_per_group(Group, Config) ->
  138:     case lists:member(Group, ?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES ++ z64(?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES)) of
  139:         true ->
  140:             case get_value(zip, Config) of
  141:                 undefined ->
  142:                     Pdir = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),Group),
  143:                     ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  144:                     [{pdir, Pdir},{zip, noz64(Group)} | Config];
  145:                 _Zip ->
  146:                     Pdir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config),Group),
  147:                     ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  148:                     [{pdir, Pdir},{unzip, noz64(Group)} | Config]
  149:             end;
  150:         false ->
  151:             Config
  152:     end.
  153: 
  154: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  155:     file:del_dir_r(get_value(pdir,Config)),
  156:     Config.
  157: 
  158: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) ->
  159:     UsesZip = get_value(zip, Config) =:= zip orelse get_value(unzip, Config) =:= unzip,
  160:     HasZip = has_zip(),
  161:     UsesEMZip = get_value(zip, Config) =:= emzip orelse get_value(unzip, Config) =:= unemzip,
  162:     Memsize = memsize(),
  163:     if UsesZip andalso not HasZip ->
  164:             {skip, "No zip command found"};
  165:        UsesEMZip andalso Memsize < 8 bsl 30 ->
  166:             {skip, "Testing emzip needs more that 8 GB of memory"};
  167:        true ->
  168:             PrivDir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config,get_value(priv_dir, Config)), TC),
  169:             ok = filelib:ensure_path(PrivDir),
  170:             [{pdir, PrivDir} | Config]
  171:     end.
  172: 
  173: 
  174: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  175:     file:del_dir_r(get_value(pdir,Config)),
  176:     Config.
  177: 
  178: %% Test creating, listing and extracting one file from an archive
  179: %% multiple times with different file sizes. Also check that the
  180: %% modification date of the extracted file has survived.
  181: borderline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  182:     RootDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  183:     TempDir = filename:join(RootDir, "borderline"),
  184: 
  185:     Record = 512,
  186:     Block = 20 * Record,
  187: 
  188:     lists:foreach(fun(Size) -> borderline_test(Size, TempDir) end,
  189:                   [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 333, Record-1, Record, Record+1,
  190:                    Block-Record-1, Block-Record, Block-Record+1,
  191:                    Block-1, Block, Block+1,
  192:                    Block+Record-1, Block+Record, Block+Record+1]),
  193: 
  194:     %% Clean up.
  195:     delete_files([TempDir]),
  196:     ok.
  197: 
  198: borderline_test(Size, TempDir) ->
  199:     Archive = filename:join(TempDir, "ar_"++integer_to_list(Size)++".zip"),
  200:     Name = filename:join(TempDir, "file_"++integer_to_list(Size)),
  201:     io:format("Testing size ~p", [Size]),
  202: 
  203:     %% Create a file and archive it.
  204:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
  205:     file:write_file(Name, random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
  206:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [Name]),
  207:     ok = file:delete(Name),
  208: 
  209:     %% Verify listing and extracting.
  210:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = []},
  211:           #zip_file{name = Name,
  212:                     info = Info,
  213:                     offset = 0,
  214:                     comp_size = _}]} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
  215:     Size = Info#file_info.size,
  216:     {ok, [Name]} = zip:extract(Archive, [verbose]),
  217: 
  218:     %% Verify contents of extracted file.
  219:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  220:     true = match_byte_list(X0, binary_to_list(Bin)),
  221: 
  222: 
  223:     %% Verify that Unix zip can read it. (if we have a unix zip that is!)
  224:     zipinfo_match(Archive, Name),
  225: 
  226:     ok.
  227: 
  228: zipinfo_match(Archive, Name) ->
  229:     case check_zipinfo_exists() of
  230:         true ->
  231:             Encoding = file:native_name_encoding(),
  232:             Expect = unicode:characters_to_binary(Name ++ "\n",
  233:                                                   Encoding, Encoding),
  234:             cmd_expect("zipinfo -1 " ++ Archive, Expect);
  235:         _ ->
  236:             ok
  237:     end.
  238: 
  239: check_zipinfo_exists() ->
  240:     is_list(os:find_executable("zipinfo")).
  241: 
  242: cmd_expect(Cmd, Expect) ->
  243:     Port = open_port({spawn, make_cmd(Cmd)}, [stream, in, binary, eof]),
  244:     get_data(Port, Expect, <<>>).
  245: 
  246: get_data(Port, Expect, Acc) ->
  247:     receive
  248:         {Port, {data, Bytes}} ->
  249:             get_data(Port, Expect, <<Acc/binary, Bytes/binary>>);
  250:         {Port, eof} ->
  251:             Port ! {self(), close},
  252:             receive
  253:                 {Port, closed} ->
  254:                     true
  255:             end,
  256:             receive
  257:                 {'EXIT',  Port,  _} ->
  258:                     ok
  259:             after 1 ->                          % force context switch
  260:                     ok
  261:             end,
  262:             match_output(Acc, Expect, Port)
  263:     end.
  264: 
  265: match_output(<<C, Output/bits>>, <<C,Expect/bits>>, Port) ->
  266:     match_output(Output, Expect, Port);
  267: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>, <<_, _/bits>>, Port) ->
  268:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, badmatch);
  269: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>=Rest, <<>>, Port) ->
  270:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, {too_much_data, Rest});
  271: match_output(<<>>, <<>>, _Port) ->
  272:     ok.
  273: 
  274: kill_port_and_fail(Port, Reason) ->
  275:     unlink(Port),
  276:     exit(Port, die),
  277:     ct:fail(Reason).
  278: 
  279: make_cmd(Cmd) ->
  280:     Cmd.
  281: %%     case os:type() of
  282: %%      {win32, _} -> lists:concat(["cmd /c",  Cmd]);
  283: %%      {unix, _}  -> lists:concat(["sh -c '",  Cmd,  "'"])
  284: %%     end.
  285: 
  286: %% Verifies a random byte list.
  287: 
  288: match_byte_list(X0, [Byte|Rest]) ->
  289:     X = next_random(X0),
  290:     case (X bsr 26) band 16#ff of
  291:         Byte -> match_byte_list(X, Rest);
  292:         _ -> false
  293:     end;
  294: match_byte_list(_, []) ->
  295:     true.
  296: 
  297: %% Generates a random byte list.
  298: 
  299: random_byte_list(X0, Count) ->
  300:     random_byte_list(X0, Count, []).
  301: 
  302: random_byte_list(X0, Count, Result) when Count > 0->
  303:     X = next_random(X0),
  304:     random_byte_list(X, Count-1, [(X bsr 26) band 16#ff|Result]);
  305: random_byte_list(_X, 0, Result) ->
  306:     lists:reverse(Result).
  307: 
  308: %% This RNG is from line 21 on page 102 in Knuth: The Art of Computer Programming,
  309: %% Volume II, Seminumerical Algorithms.
  310: 
  311: next_random(X) ->
  312:     (X*17059465+1) band 16#fffffffff.
  313: 
  314: %% Test the 'atomic' operations: zip/unzip/list_dir, on archives.
  315: %% Also test the 'cooked' option.
  316: atomic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  317:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  318:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  319:     Names = [Name || {Name,_,_} <- DataFiles],
  320:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  321: 
  322:     %% Create a zip  archive.
  323: 
  324:     Zip2 = "zip.zip",
  325:     {ok, Zip2} = zip:zip(Zip2, Names, []),
  326:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip2)),
  327: 
  328:     %% Same test again, but this time created with 'cooked'
  329: 
  330:     Zip3 = "cooked.zip",
  331:     {ok, Zip3} = zip:zip(Zip3, Names, [cooked]),
  332:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3)),
  333:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3, [cooked])),
  334: 
  335:     %% Clean up.
  336:     delete_files([Zip2,Zip3|Names]),
  337: 
  338:     ok.
  339: 
  340: %% Test the zip_open/2, zip_get/1, zip_get/2, zip_close/1,
  341: %% and zip_list_dir/1 functions.
  342: zip_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  343:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  344:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  345:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  346:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  347: 
  348:     %% Create a zip archive
  349:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  350:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, Names, []),
  351: 
  352:     %% Open archive
  353:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  354: 
  355:     %% List dir
  356:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  357: 
  358:     %% Get a file
  359:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  360:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(Name1),
  361:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  362:     Data1Crc = erlang:crc32(Data1),
  363:     {ok, Data1Crc} = zip:zip_get_crc32(Name1, ZipSrv),
  364: 
  365:     %% Get all files
  366:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(Name),
  367:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  368:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  369: 
  370:     %% Close
  371:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  372: 
  373:     %% Clean up.
  374:     delete_files([Names]),
  375: 
  376:     ok.
  377: 
  378: %% Test that zip doesn't leak processes and ports where the
  379: %% controlling process dies without closing an zip opened with
  380: %% zip:zip_open/1.
  381: open_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  382:     %% Create a zip archive
  383:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  384:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, [], []),
  385: 
  386:     %% Open archive in a another process that dies immediately.
  387:     ZipSrv = spawn_zip(Zip, [memory]),
  388: 
  389:     %% Expect the ZipSrv process to die soon after.
  390:     true = spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv),
  391: 
  392:     %% Clean up.
  393:     delete_files([Zip]),
  394: 
  395:     ok.
  396: 
  397: spawn_zip(Zip, Options) ->
  398:     Self = self(),
  399:     spawn(fun() -> Self ! zip:zip_open(Zip, Options) end),
  400:     receive
  401:         {ok, ZipSrv} ->
  402:             ZipSrv
  403:     end.
  404: 
  405: spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv) ->
  406:     Ref = monitor(process, ZipSrv),
  407:     receive
  408:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, ZipSrv, _} ->
  409:             true
  410:     after 1000 ->
  411:             false
  412:     end.
  413: 
  414: %% Test options for unzip, only cwd and file_list currently.
  415: unzip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  416:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  417:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  418:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  419: 
  420:     %% create a temp directory
  421:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "t"),
  422:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  423: 
  424:     FList = ["quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt"],
  425: 
  426:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  427:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},
  428: 				     {file_list, FList}]),
  429: 
  430:     %% Verify.
  431:     true = (length(FList) =:= length(RetList)),
  432:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  433: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  434: 		  FList),
  435:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  436: 		  RetList),
  437: 
  438:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  439:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  440: 
  441:     FList2 = ["abc.txt","quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt","emptyFile"],
  442: 
  443:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  444:     {ok, RetList2} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},skip_directories]),
  445: 
  446:     %% Verify.
  447:     true = (length(RetList2) =:= 4),
  448:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  449: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  450: 		  FList2),
  451:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  452: 		  RetList2),
  453: 
  454:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  455:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  456:     ok.
  457: 
  458: %% Test that unzip handles directory traversal exploit (OTP-13633)
  459: unzip_traversal_exploit(Config) ->
  460:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  461:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  462:     ZipName = filename:join(DataDir, "exploit.zip"),
  463: 
  464:     %% $ zipinfo -1 test/zip_SUITE_data/exploit.zip 
  465:     %% clash.txt
  466:     %% ../clash.txt
  467:     %% ../above.txt
  468:     %% subdir/../in_root_dir.txt
  469: 
  470:     %% create a temp directory
  471:     SubDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "exploit_test"),
  472:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  473:     
  474:     ClashFile = filename:join(SubDir,"clash.txt"),
  475:     AboveFile = filename:join(SubDir,"above.txt"),
  476:     RelativePathFile = filename:join(SubDir,"subdir/../in_root_dir.txt"),
  477: 
  478:     %% unzip in SubDir
  479:     {ok, [ClashFile, ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  480: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir}]),
  481: 
  482:     {ok,<<"This file will overwrite other file.\n">>} =
  483: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  484:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(AboveFile),
  485:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(RelativePathFile),
  486: 
  487:     %% clean up
  488:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  489:     
  490:      %% create the temp directory again
  491:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  492: 
  493:     %% unzip in SubDir
  494:     {ok, [ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  495: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir},keep_old_files]),
  496: 
  497:     {ok,<<"This is the original file.\n">>} =
  498: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  499:    
  500:     %% clean up
  501:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  502:     ok.
  503: 
  504: %% Test unzip a jar file (OTP-7382).
  505: unzip_jar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  506:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  507:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  508:     JarFile = filename:join(DataDir, "test.jar"),
  509: 
  510:     %% create a temp directory
  511:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "jartest"),
  512:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  513: 
  514:     FList = ["META-INF/MANIFEST.MF","test.txt"],
  515: 
  516:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(JarFile, [{cwd, Subdir}]),
  517: 
  518:     %% Verify.
  519:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  520: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  521: 		  FList),
  522:     lists:foreach(fun(F)->
  523:                           case lists:last(F) =:= $/ of
  524:                               true -> ok = file:del_dir(F);
  525:                               false -> ok = file:delete(F)
  526:                           end
  527:                   end,
  528: 		  lists:reverse(RetList)),
  529: 
  530:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  531:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  532:     ok.
  533: 
  534: %% Test the options for unzip, only cwd currently.
  535: zip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  536:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  537:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  538:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  539:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  540: 
  541:     %% Make sure cwd is not where we get the files
  542:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  543: 
  544:     %% Create a zip archive
  545:     {ok, {_,Zip}} =
  546:         zip:zip("filename_not_used.zip", Names, [memory, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
  547: 
  548:     %% Open archive
  549:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  550: 
  551:     %% List dir
  552:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  553: 
  554:     %% Get a file
  555:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  556:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name1)),
  557:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  558: 
  559:     %% Get all files
  560:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name)),
  561:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  562:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  563: 
  564:     %% Close
  565:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  566: 
  567:     %% Clean up.
  568:     delete_files([Names]),
  569: 
  570:     ok.
  571: 
  572: %% Test the options for list_dir... one day.
  573: list_dir_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  574: 
  575:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  576:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  577: 
  578:     {ok,
  579:      ["abc.txt", "quotes/rain.txt", "empty/", "wikipedia.txt", "emptyFile" ]} =
  580:         zip:list_dir(Archive,[names_only]),
  581: 
  582:     {ok,
  583:      [#zip_comment{},
  584:       #zip_file{ name = "abc.txt" },
  585:       #zip_file{ name = "quotes/rain.txt" },
  586:       #zip_file{ name = "wikipedia.txt" },
  587:       #zip_file{ name = "emptyFile" }
  588:      ]} =  zip:list_dir(Archive,[skip_directories]),
  589: 
  590:     ok.
  591: 
  592: %% convert zip_info as returned from list_dir to a list of names
  593: names_from_list_dir({ok, Info}) ->
  594:     names_from_list_dir(Info);
  595: names_from_list_dir(Info) ->
  596:     tl(lists:map(fun(#zip_file{name = Name}) -> Name;
  597:                     (_) -> ok end, Info)).
  598: 
  599: %% Returns a sequence of characters.
  600: char_seq(N, First) ->
  601:     char_seq(N, First, []).
  602: 
  603: char_seq(0, _, Result) ->
  604:     Result;
  605: char_seq(N, C, Result) when C < 127 ->
  606:     char_seq(N-1, C+1, [C|Result]);
  607: char_seq(N, _, Result) ->
  608:     char_seq(N, $!, Result).
  609: 
  610: data_files() ->
  611:     Files = [{"first_file", 1555, $a},
  612:              {"small_file", 7, $d},
  613:              {"big_file", 23875, $e},
  614:              {"last_file", 7500, $g}],
  615:     create_files(Files),
  616:     Files.
  617: 
  618: create_files([{Name, dir, _First}|Rest]) ->
  619:     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  620:     create_files(Rest);
  621: create_files([{Name, Size, First}|Rest]) when is_integer(Size) ->
  622:     ok = file:write_file(Name, char_seq(Size, First)),
  623:     create_files(Rest);
  624: create_files([]) ->
  625:     ok.
  626:

  631: %%     Name = filename:join(Parent, Dir),
  632: %%     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  633: %%     make_dirs(Rest, Name);
  634: %% make_dirs([], Dir) ->
  635: %%     Dir.

  637: %% Try zip:unzip/1 on some corrupted zip files.
  638: bad_zip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  639:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  640:     try_bad("bad_crc",    {bad_crc, "abc.txt"}, Config),
  641:     try_bad("bad_central_directory", bad_central_directory, Config),
  642:     try_bad("bad_file_header",    bad_file_header, Config),
  643:     try_bad("bad_eocd",    bad_eocd, Config),
  644:     try_bad("enoent", enoent, Config),
  645:     GetNotFound = fun(A) ->
  646:                           {ok, O} = zip:zip_open(A, []),
  647:                           zip:zip_get("not_here", O)
  648:                   end,
  649:     try_bad("abc", file_not_found, GetNotFound, Config),
  650:     ok.
  651: 
  652: try_bad(N, R, Config) ->
  653:     try_bad(N, R, fun(A) -> io:format("name : ~p\n", [A]),
  654:                             zip:unzip(A, [verbose]) end, Config).
  655: 
  656: try_bad(Name0, Reason, What, Config) ->
  657:     %% Intentionally no macros here.
  658: 
  659:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  660:     Name = Name0 ++ ".zip",
  661:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [Name]),
  662:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  663:     Expected = {error, Reason},
  664:     case What(Full) of
  665:         Expected ->
  666:             io:format("Result: ~p\n", [Expected]);
  667:         Other ->
  668:             io:format("unzip/2 returned ~p (expected ~p)\n", [Other, Expected]),
  669:             ct:fail({bad_return_value, Other})
  670:     end.
  671: 
  672: %% Test extracting to binary with memory option.
  673: unzip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  674:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  675:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  676:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "unzip_to_binary"),
  677:     _ = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  678:     _ = file:make_dir(filename:join(DataDir, "empty")),
  679: 
  680:     ok = file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  681:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  682: 
  683:     %% Unzip a zip file into a binary
  684:     {ok, FBList} = zip:unzip(Long, [memory]),
  685: 
  686:     %% Verify.
  687:     lists:foreach(fun({F,B}) ->
  688:                           Filename = filename:join(DataDir, F),
  689:                           case lists:last(F) =:= $/ of
  690:                               true ->
  691:                                   <<>> = B,
  692:                                   {ok, #file_info{ type = directory}} =
  693:                                       file:read_file_info(Filename);
  694:                               false ->
  695:                                   {ok,B}=file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F))
  696:                           end
  697:                   end, FBList),
  698: 
  699:     %% Make sure no files created in cwd
  700:     {ok,[]} = file:list_dir(WorkDir),
  701: 
  702:     ok.
  703:

  757: %% Test extracting a zip archive from a binary.
  758: unzip_from_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  759:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  760:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  761:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_binary"),
  762:     Archive = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.zip"),
  763: 
  764:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  765:     {ok, _Size} = file:copy(filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"), Archive),
  766:     FileName = "abc.txt",
  767:     Quote = "quotes/rain.txt",

  769:     EmptyFile = "emptyFile",
  770:     EmptyDir = "empty/",
  771:     file:set_cwd(ExtractDir),
  772:

  774:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Archive),
  775:     {ok, [FileName,Quote,EmptyDir,Wikipedia,EmptyFile]} = zip:unzip(Bin),
  776: 
  777:     %% Verify.
  778:     DestFilename = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.txt"),
  779:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, FileName)),
  780:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),
  781: 
  782:     DestQuote = filename:join([ExtractDir, "quotes", "rain.txt"]),
  783:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  784:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  785: 
  786:     %% Clean up.
  787:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, Archive, ExtractDir]),
  788: 
  789:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  790:     file:set_cwd(ExtractDir),
  791: 
  792:     %% Read a zip file into a binary and extract from the binary with skip_directories
  793:     {ok, [FileName,Quote,Wikipedia,EmptyFile]}
  794:         = zip:unzip(Bin, [skip_directories]),
  795: 
  796:     %% Verify.
  797:     DestFilename = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.txt"),
  798:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, FileName)),
  799:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),
  800: 
  801:     DestQuote = filename:join([ExtractDir, "quotes", "rain.txt"]),
  802:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  803:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  804: 
  805:     %% Clean up.
  806:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, ExtractDir]),
  807: 
  808:     ok.

  810: %% oac_files() ->
  811: %%     Files = [{"oac_file", 1459, $x},
  812: %%           {"oac_small", 99, $w},
  813: %%           {"oac_big", 33896, $A}],
  814: %%     create_files(Files),

  816: 
  817: %% Delete the given list of files and directories.
  818: %% Return total number of deleted files (not directories)
  819: delete_files(List) ->
  820:     do_delete_files(List, 0).
  821: do_delete_files([],Cnt) ->
  822:     Cnt;
  823: do_delete_files([Item|Rest], Cnt) ->
  824:     case file:delete(Item) of
  825:         ok ->
  826:             DelCnt = 1;
  827:         {error,eperm} ->
  828:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  829:             DelCnt = delete_files(filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Item, "*"))),
  830:             file:del_dir(Item);
  831:         {error,eacces} ->
  832:             %% We'll see about that!
  833:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  834:             case file:delete(Item) of
  835:                 ok ->
  836: 		    DelCnt = 1;
  837:                 {error,_} ->
  838:                     erlang:yield(),
  839:                     file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  840:                     file:delete(Item),
  841:                     DelCnt = 1
  842:             end;
  843:         {error,_} ->
  844:             DelCnt = 0
  845:     end,
  846:     do_delete_files(Rest, Cnt + DelCnt).
  847: 
  848: %% Test control of which files that should be compressed.
  849: compress_control(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  850:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  851:     Dir = "compress_control",
  852:     Files = [
  853:              {Dir,                                                          dir,   $d},
  854:              {filename:join([Dir, "first_file.txt"]), 10000, $f},
  855:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  856:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "zzz.zip"]), 10000, $z},
  857:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "lll.lzh"]), 10000, $l},
  858:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "eee.exe"]), 10000, $e},
  859:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $g},
  860:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  861:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $a},
  862:              {filename:join([Dir, "last_file.txt"]), 10000, $l}
  863:             ],
  864: 
  865:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  866: 			  Files,
  867: 			  [{compress, []}],
  868: 			  []),
  869: 
  870:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  871: 			  Files,
  872: 			  [{uncompress, all}],
  873: 			  []),
  874: 
  875:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  876: 			  Files,
  877: 			  [{uncompress, []}],
  878: 			  [".txt", ".exe", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  879: 
  880:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  881: 			  Files,
  882: 			  [],
  883: 			  [".txt", ".exe"]),
  884: 
  885:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  886: 			  Files,
  887: 			  [{uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  888: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  889: 			  [".txt", ".zip", "arj"]),
  890: 
  891:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  892: 			  Files,
  893: 			  [{uncompress, []},
  894: 			   {uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  895: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  896: 			  [".txt", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  897: 
  898:     ok.
  899: 
  900: test_compress_control(Dir, Files, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  901:     %% Cleanup
  902:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  903:     Names = [N || {N, _, _} <- Files],
  904:     delete_files([Zip]),
  905:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)),
  906: 
  907:     create_files(Files),
  908:     {ok, Zip} = zip:create(Zip, [Dir], ZipOptions),
  909: 
  910:     {ok, OpenZip} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  911:     {ok,[#zip_comment{comment = ""} | ZipList]} = zip:zip_list_dir(OpenZip),
  912:     io:format("compress_control:  -> ~p  -> ~p\n  -> ~pn", [Expected, ZipOptions, ZipList]),
  913:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected),
  914:     ok = zip:zip_close(OpenZip),
  915: 
  916:     %% Cleanup
  917:     delete_files([Zip]),
  918:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)), % Remove plain files before directories
  919: 
  920:     ok.
  921: 
  922: verify_compression([{Name, Kind, _Filler} | Files], ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  923:     {Name2, BinSz} =
  924:         case Kind of
  925:             dir ->
  926:                 {Name ++ "/", 0};
  927:             _   ->
  928:                 {ok, {Name, Bin}} = zip:zip_get(Name, OpenZip),
  929:                 {Name, size(Bin)}
  930:         end,
  931:     {Name2, {value, ZipFile}} = {Name2, lists:keysearch(Name2,  #zip_file.name, ZipList)},
  932:     #zip_file{info = #file_info{size = InfoSz, type = InfoType}, comp_size = InfoCompSz} = ZipFile,
  933: 
  934:     Ext = filename:extension(Name),
  935:     IsComp = is_compressed(Ext, Kind, ZipOptions),
  936:     ExpComp = lists:member(Ext, Expected),
  937:     case {Name, Kind, InfoType, IsComp, ExpComp, BinSz, InfoSz, InfoCompSz} of
  938:         {_, dir, directory, false, _,     Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  939:         {_, Sz,  regular,   false, false, Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  940:         {_, Sz,  regular,   true,  true,  Sz, Sz, OtherSz} when Sz =:= BinSz, OtherSz =/= BinSz -> ok
  941:     end,
  942:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList -- [ZipFile], OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected);
  943: verify_compression([], [], _OpenZip, _ZipOptions, _Expected) ->
  944:     ok.
  945: 
  946: is_compressed(_Ext, dir, _Options) ->
  947:     false;
  948: is_compressed(Ext, _Sz, Options) ->
  949:     CompressOpt =
  950:         case [What || {compress, What} <- Options] of
  951:             [] -> all;
  952:             CompressOpts-> extensions(CompressOpts, all)
  953:         end,
  954:     DoCompress = (CompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, CompressOpt),
  955:     Default = [".Z", ".zip", ".zoo", ".arc", ".lzh", ".arj"],
  956:     UncompressOpt =
  957:         case [What || {uncompress, What} <- Options] of
  958:             [] -> Default;
  959:             UncompressOpts-> extensions(UncompressOpts, Default)
  960:         end,
  961:     DoUncompress = (UncompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, UncompressOpt),
  962:     DoCompress andalso not DoUncompress.
  963: 
  964: extensions([H | T], Old) ->
  965:     case H of
  966:         all ->
  967:             extensions(T, H);
  968:         H when is_list(H) ->
  969:             extensions(T, H);
  970:         {add, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  971:             extensions(T, Old ++ New);
  972:         {del, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  973:             extensions(T, Old -- New);
  974:         _ ->
  975:             extensions(T, Old)
  976:     end;
  977: extensions([], Old) ->
  978:     Old.
  979: 
  980: foldl(Config) ->
  981:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  982:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "foldl.zip"]),
  983: 
  984:     FooBin = <<"FOO">>,
  985:     BarBin = <<"BAR">>,
  986:     Files = [{"foo", FooBin}, {"bar", BarBin}],
  987:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, Files, [memory,{extra,[]}]),
  988:     ZipFun = fun(N, I, B, Acc) -> [{N, B(), I()} | Acc] end,
  989:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, Bin}),
  990:     [{"bar", BarBin, #file_info{}}, {"foo", FooBin, #file_info{}}] = FileSpec,
  991:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, lists:reverse(FileSpec), [memory,{extra,[]}]),
  992:     {foo_bin, FooBin} =
  993: 	try
  994: 	    zip:foldl(fun("foo", _, B, _) -> throw(B()); (_, _, _, Acc) -> Acc end, [], {File, Bin})
  995: 	catch
  996: 	    throw:FooBin ->
  997: 		{foo_bin, FooBin}
  998: 	end,
  999:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
 1000:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1001: 
 1002:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(fun() -> ok end, [], File),
 1003:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], 42),
 1004:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, 42}),
 1005: 
 1006:     ok = file:delete(File),
 1007:     {error, enoent} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1008: 
 1009:     ok.
 1010: 
 1011: fd_leak(Config) ->
 1012:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1013:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1014:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_file_header.zip"),
 1015:     BadExtract = fun() ->
 1016:                          {error,bad_file_header} = zip:extract(Name),
 1017:                          ok
 1018:                  end,
 1019:     do_fd_leak(BadExtract, 1),
 1020: 
 1021:     BadCreate = fun() ->
 1022:                         {error,enoent} = zip:zip("failed.zip",
 1023:                                                  ["none"]),
 1024:                         ok
 1025:                 end,
 1026:     do_fd_leak(BadCreate, 1),
 1027: 
 1028:     ok.
 1029: 
 1030: do_fd_leak(_Bad, 10000) ->
 1031:     ok;
 1032: do_fd_leak(Bad, N) ->
 1033:     try Bad() of
 1034:         ok ->
 1035:             do_fd_leak(Bad, N + 1)
 1036:     catch
 1037:         C:R:Stk ->
 1038:             io:format("Bad error after ~p attempts\n", [N]),
 1039:             erlang:raise(C, R, Stk)
 1040:     end.
 1041: 
 1042: unicode(Config) ->
 1043:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
 1044:         latin1 ->
 1045:             {comment, "Native name encoding is Latin-1; skipping all tests"};
 1046:         utf8 ->
 1047:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1048:             ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1049:             test_file_comment(DataDir),
 1050:             test_archive_comment(DataDir),
 1051:             test_bad_comment(DataDir),
 1052:             test_latin1_archive(DataDir),
 1053:             case has_zip() of
 1054:                 false ->
 1055:                     {comment, "No zip program found; skipping some tests"};
 1056:                 true ->
 1057:                     case zip_is_unicode_aware() of
 1058:                         true ->
 1059:                             test_filename_compatibility(),
 1060:                             ok;
 1061:                         false ->
 1062:                             {comment, "Old zip program; skipping some tests"}
 1063:                     end
 1064:             end
 1065:     end.
 1066: 
 1067: test_filename_compatibility() ->
 1068:     FancyName = "üñíĉòdë한",
 1069:     Archive = "test.zip",
 1070: 
 1071:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [{FancyName, <<"test">>}]),
 1072:     zipinfo_match(Archive, FancyName).
 1073: 
 1074: test_file_comment(DataDir) ->
 1075:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_file_comment.zip"),
 1076:     Comments = ["a", [246], [1024]],
 1077:     FileNames = [[C] ++ ".txt" || C <- [$a, 246, 1024]],
 1078:     [begin
 1079:          test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive),
 1080:          test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive)
 1081:      end ||
 1082:         Comment <- Comments, FileName <- FileNames],
 1083:     ok.
 1084: 
 1085: test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1086:     _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1087:     io:format("*** zip:zip(). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1088:               [FileName, Comment]),
 1089:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1090:     {ok, Archive} =
 1091:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1092:     zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "").
 1093: 
 1094: test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1095:     case test_zip1() of
 1096:         false ->
 1097:             ok;
 1098:         true ->
 1099:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1100:             io:format("*** zip(1). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1101:                       [FileName, Comment]),
 1102:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1103:             R = os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -c " ++
 1104:                            Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1105:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [R]),
 1106:             zip_check(Archive, "", FileName, Comment)
 1107:     end.
 1108: 
 1109: test_archive_comment(DataDir) ->
 1110:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_archive_comment.zip"),
 1111:     Chars = [$a, 246, 1024],
 1112:     [test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) || Char <- Chars],
 1113:     ok.
 1114: 
 1115: test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) ->
 1116:     case test_zip1() of
 1117:         false ->
 1118:             ok;
 1119:         true ->
 1120:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1121:             FileName = "a.txt",
 1122:             Comment = [Char],
 1123:             io:format("*** Testing archive Comment ~ts\n", [Comment]),
 1124:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1125: 
 1126:             {ok, _} =
 1127:                 zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1128:             Res = os:cmd("zip -z " ++ Archive),
 1129:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [Res]),
 1130:             true = lists:member(Char, Res),
 1131: 
 1132:             os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -z "++
 1133:                        Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1134:             zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "")
 1135:     end.
 1136: 
 1137: test_zip1() ->
 1138:     has_zip() andalso zip_is_unicode_aware().
 1139: 
 1140: has_zip() ->
 1141:     os:find_executable("zip") =/= false.
 1142: 
 1143: zip_is_unicode_aware() ->
 1144:     S = os:cmd("zip -v | grep 'UNICODE_SUPPORT'"),
 1145:     string:find(S, "UNICODE_SUPPORT") =/= nomatch.
 1146: 
 1147: zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, FileNameComment) ->
 1148:     {ok, CommentAndFiles} = zip:table(Archive),
 1149:     io:format("zip:table/1 returns\n  ~lp\n", [CommentAndFiles]),
 1150:     io:format("checking archive comment ~lp\n", [ArchiveComment]),
 1151:     [_] = [C || #zip_comment{comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1152:                 C =:= ArchiveComment],
 1153:     io:format("checking filename ~lp\n", [FileName]),
 1154:     io:format("and filename comment ~lp\n", [FileNameComment]),
 1155:     [_] = [F || #zip_file{name = F, comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1156:                 F =:= FileName, C =:= FileNameComment],
 1157:     {ok, FileList} = zip:unzip(Archive, [verbose]),
 1158:     io:format("zip:unzip/2 returns\n  ~lp\n", [FileList]),
 1159:     true = lists:member(FileName, FileList),
 1160:     ok.
 1161: 
 1162: test_bad_comment(DataDir) ->
 1163:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_bad_comment.zip"),
 1164:     FileName = "a.txt",
 1165:     file:write_file(FileName, ["something"]),
 1166:     Comment = [9999999],
 1167:     {error,{bad_unicode,Comment}} =
 1168:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]).
 1169: 
 1170: test_latin1_archive(DataDir) ->
 1171:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip-latin1.zip"),
 1172:     FileName = [246] ++ ".txt",
 1173:     ArchiveComment = [246],
 1174:     zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, "").
 1175: 
 1176: test_zip_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1177:     case {os:find_executable("unzip"), os:type()} of
 1178:         {UnzipPath, {unix,_}} when is_list(UnzipPath)->
 1179:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1180:             Dir = filename:join([DataDir, "test-zip", "dir-1"]),
 1181:             TestZipOutputDir = filename:join(DataDir, "test-zip-output"),
 1182:             TestZipOutput = filename:join(TestZipOutputDir, "test.zip"),
 1183:             zip:create(TestZipOutput, [Dir]),
 1184:             run_command(UnzipPath, ["-o", TestZipOutput,  "-d", TestZipOutputDir]),
 1185:             {ok, FileContent} = file:read_file(filename:join([TestZipOutputDir, Dir, "file.txt"])),
 1186:             <<"OKOK\n">> = FileContent,
 1187:             ok;
 1188:         _ -> {skip, "Not Unix or unzip program not found"}
 1189:     end.
 1190: 
 1191: run_command(Command, Args) ->
 1192:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Command}, [{args, Args}, exit_status]),
 1193:     (fun Reciver() ->
 1194:              receive
 1195:                  {Port,{exit_status,_}} -> ok;
 1196:                  {Port, S} -> io:format("UNZIP: ~p~n", [S]),
 1197:                               Reciver()
 1198:              end
 1199:      end)().
 1200:     
 1201: explicit_file_info(_Config) ->
 1202:     Epoch = {{1980,1,1},{0,0,0}},
 1203:     FileInfo = #file_info{type=regular, size=0, mtime=Epoch},
 1204:     Files = [{"datetime", <<>>, FileInfo},
 1205:              {"seconds", <<>>, FileInfo#file_info{mtime=315532800}}],
 1206:     {ok, _} = zip:zip("", Files, [memory]),
 1207:     ok.
 1208: 
 1209: mode(Config) ->
 1210: 
 1211:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1212:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1213:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1214: 
 1215:     Executable = filename:join(PrivDir,"exec"),
 1216:     file:write_file(Executable, "aaa"),
 1217:     {ok, ExecFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1218:     ok = file:write_file_info(Executable, ExecFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1219: 
 1220:     Directory = filename:join(PrivDir,"dir"),
 1221:     ok = file:make_dir(Directory),
 1222:     {ok, DirFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1223:     ok = file:write_file_info(Directory, DirFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1224: 
 1225:     ?assertMatch(
 1226:        {ok, Archive},
 1227:        zip(Config, Archive, "-r", ["dir","exec"], [{cwd, PrivDir},{extra,[extended_timestamp]}])),
 1228: 
 1229:     ?assertMatch(
 1230:        {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1231:              #zip_file{ name = "dir/", info = #file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400}},
 1232:              #zip_file{ name = "exec", info = #file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400}} ]},
 1233:        zip:list_dir(Archive)),
 1234: 
 1235:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1236:     ?assertMatch(
 1237:        {ok, ["dir/","exec"]}, unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1238: 
 1239:     case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1240:         true ->
 1241:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = ExecMode }} =
 1242:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"exec")),
 1243:             ?assertEqual(8#111 bor 8#400, ExecMode band 8#777),
 1244: 
 1245:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = DirMode }} =
 1246:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"dir")),
 1247:             ?assertEqual(8#111 bor 8#400, DirMode band 8#777);
 1248:         false ->
 1249:             %% emzip does not support mode
 1250:             ok
 1251:     end,
 1252: 
 1253:     ok.
 1254: 
 1255: %% Test that zip64 local and central headers are respected when unzipping.
 1256: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1257: %%  * compressed size
 1258: %%  * uncompressed size
 1259: %%  * relative offset
 1260: %%  * starting disk
 1261: %%
 1262: %% As we do not support using multiple disks, we do not test starting disks
 1263: zip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1264: 
 1265:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1266:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../archive.zip"),
 1267: 
 1268:     %% Check that ../../large.txt exists and is of correct size
 1269:     {ok, #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } } =
 1270:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt")),
 1271: 
 1272:     %% We very carefully create an archive that should contain all
 1273:     %% different header combinations.
 1274:     %% - uncomp.txt: uncomp size > 4GB
 1275:     %% - uncomp.comp.zip: uncomp and comp size > 4GB
 1276:     %% - offset.txt: offset > 4GB
 1277:     %% - uncomp.offset.txt: uncomp size and offset > 4GB
 1278:     %% - uncomp.comp.offset.zip: uncomp and comp size and offset > 4GB
 1279:     %%
 1280:     %% The archive will be roughly 8 GBs large
 1281: 
 1282:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../large.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.txt")),
 1283:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../large.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.zip")),
 1284:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../medium.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "offset.txt")),
 1285:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../large.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.offset.txt")),
 1286:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../large.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.offset.zip")),
 1287:     ?assertMatch(
 1288:        {ok, Archive},
 1289:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1",
 1290:            ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip","offset.txt",
 1291:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"],
 1292:            [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1293: 
 1294:     %% Check that list archive works
 1295:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1296:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.txt",
 1297:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1298:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.zip",
 1299:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1300:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1301:           #zip_file{ name = "offset.txt",
 1302:                      info = #file_info{ size = 4 bsl 20 } },
 1303:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.offset.txt",
 1304:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1305:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.offset.zip",
 1306:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1307:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } }
 1308:          ]} =
 1309:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1310:     ok.
 1311: 
 1312: unzip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1313: 
 1314:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1315:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1316:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../../archive.zip"),
 1317:     Large4GB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),"large.txt"),
 1318:     Medium4MB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config), "medium.txt"),
 1319: 
 1320:     %% Test that extraction of each file works
 1321:     lists:map(
 1322:       fun F({Name, Compare}) ->
 1323:               ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1324:               ?assertMatch(
 1325:                  {ok, [Name]},
 1326:                  unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,[Name]}])),
 1327:               cmp(Compare, filename:join(ExtractDir,Name)),
 1328:               file:del_dir_r(ExtractDir);
 1329:           F(Name) ->
 1330:               F({Name, Large4GB})
 1331:       end, ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip",{"offset.txt",Medium4MB},
 1332:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"]),
 1333: 
 1334:     ok.
 1335: 
 1336: %% Test that zip64 end of central directory are respected when unzipping.
 1337: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1338: %%   * total number of files > 2 bytes
 1339: %%   * size of central directory > 4 bytes (cannot test as it requires an archive with 8 million files)
 1340: %%   * offset of central directory > 4 bytes (implicitly tested when testing large relative location of header)
 1341: %%
 1342: %% Fields that we don't test as we don't support multiple disks
 1343: %%   * number of disk where end of central directory is > 2 bytes
 1344: %%   * number of disk to find central directory > 2 bytes
 1345: %%   * number central directory entries on this disk > 2 bytes
 1346: zip64_central_directory(Config) ->
 1347: 
 1348:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1349:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "files"),
 1350:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1351: 
 1352:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1353: 
 1354:     %% To test when total number of files > 65535, we create an archive with 66000 entries
 1355:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
 1356:     lists:foreach(
 1357:       fun(I) ->
 1358:               ok = file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, integer_to_list(I)++".txt"),<<0:8>>)
 1359:       end, lists:seq(0, 65600)),
 1360:     ?assertMatch(
 1361:        {ok, Archive},
 1362:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1 -r", ["files"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1363: 
 1364:     {ok, Files} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1365:     ?assertEqual(65603, length(Files)),
 1366: 
 1367:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1368:     ?assertMatch(
 1369:        {ok, ["files/1.txt","files/65599.txt"]},
 1370:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,["files/1.txt",
 1371:                                                              "files/65599.txt"]}])),
 1372:     cmp(filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/1.txt"),
 1373:         filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/65599.txt")),
 1374: 
 1375:     ok.
 1376: 
 1377: %% Test basic timestamps, the atime and mtime should be the original
 1378: %% mtime of the file
 1379: basic_timestamp(Config) ->
 1380:     PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1381:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1382:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1383:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1384: 
 1385:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1386:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1387:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1388: 
 1389:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1390:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1391: 
 1392:     %% Create an archive without extended timestamps
 1393:     ?assertMatch(
 1394:        {ok, Archive},
 1395:        zip(Config, Archive, "-X", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}, {extra, []}])),
 1396: 
 1397:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1398:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime }} ]} =
 1399:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1400: 
 1401:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1402:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1403:     ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1404: 
 1405:     %% Timestamp in archive is when entry was added to archive
 1406:     %% Need to add 2 to ZMtime as the dos time in zip archives
 1407:     %% are in precise.
 1408:     ?assert(calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(Mtime) =<
 1409:                 calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(ZMtime) + 1),
 1410: 
 1411:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1412:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1413: 
 1414:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1415:     ?assertMatch(
 1416:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1417:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1418: 
 1419:     {ok, UnzipFI = #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime,
 1420:                                mtime = UnZMtime,
 1421:                                ctime = UnZCtime
 1422:                              }} =
 1423:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt")),
 1424: 
 1425: 
 1426:     ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1427: 
 1428:     case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1429:         true ->
 1430:             ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1431:             ?assertEqual(UnZAtime, UnZMtime),
 1432: 
 1433:             ?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime);
 1434:         false ->
 1435:             %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1436:             ok
 1437:     end,
 1438: 
 1439:     ok.
 1440: 
 1441: %% Test extended timestamps, the atime and ctime in the archive are
 1442: %% the atime and ctime when the file is added to the archive.
 1443: extended_timestamp(Config) ->
 1444: 
 1445:     case os:cmd("zip -v | grep USE_EF_UT_TIME") of
 1446:         "" -> {skip, "zip does not support extended timestamps"};
 1447:         _ ->
 1448:             PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1449:             Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1450:             ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1451:             Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1452: 
 1453:             ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1454:             {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1455:                 file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1456: 
 1457:             %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1458:             timer:sleep(1000),
 1459: 
 1460:             ?assertMatch(
 1461:                {ok, Archive},
 1462:                zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1463: 
 1464:             %% list_dir only reads the central directory header and thus only
 1465:             %% the mtime will be correct here
 1466:             {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1467:                   #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime}} ]} =
 1468:                 zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1469: 
 1470:             ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1471:             ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1472:             ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1473: 
 1474:             ?assertEqual(Mtime, ZMtime),
 1475: 
 1476:             %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1477:             timer:sleep(1000),
 1478: 
 1479:             ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1480:             ?assertMatch(
 1481:                {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1482:                unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1483: 
 1484:             {ok, UnzipFI = #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime,
 1485:                                        mtime = UnZMtime,
 1486:                                        ctime = UnZCtime
 1487:                                      }} =
 1488:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt")),
 1489: 
 1490:             ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1491: 
 1492:             case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1493:                 true ->
 1494:                     ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1495:                     ?assertEqual(UnZAtime, UnZMtime),
 1496: 
 1497:                     ?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime);
 1498:                 false ->
 1499:                     %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1500:                     ok
 1501:             end,
 1502: 
 1503:             ok
 1504:     end.
 1505: 
 1506: uid_gid(Config) ->
 1507: 
 1508:     case os:cmd("zip -v | grep STORE_UNIX_UIDs_GIDs") of
 1509:         "" -> {skip, "zip does not support uid/gids"};
 1510:         _ ->
 1511: 
 1512:             PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1513:             ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1514:             Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1515:             Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1516: 
 1517:             ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1518:             {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ gid = GID, uid = UID }} =
 1519:                 file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1520: 
 1521:             ?assertMatch(
 1522:                {ok, Archive},
 1523:                zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1524: 
 1525:             {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1526:                   #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ gid = ZGID, uid = ZUID }} ]} =
 1527:                 zip:list_dir(Archive,[{extra, [uid_gid]}]),
 1528: 
 1529:             ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1530:             ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1531: 
 1532:             ?assertEqual(UID, ZUID),
 1533:             ?assertEqual(GID, ZGID),
 1534: 
 1535:             ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1536:             ?assertMatch(
 1537:                {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1538:                unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{extra,[uid_gid]}])),
 1539: 
 1540:             {ok,#file_info{ gid = ExZGID, uid = ExZUID }} =
 1541:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"testfile.txt")),
 1542: 
 1543:             case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1544:                 true ->
 1545:                     ?assertEqual(UID, ExZUID),
 1546:                     ?assertEqual(GID, ExZGID);
 1547:                 _ ->
 1548:                     %% emzip does not support uid_gid
 1549:                     ok
 1550:             end,
 1551: 
 1552:             ok
 1553:     end.
 1554: 
 1555: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1556: %%% Generic zip interface
 1557: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1558: zip(Config, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1559:     zip(get_value(zip, Config),
 1560:         Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1561: zip(zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1562:     cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1563:         "zip "++ZipOpts++" "++Archive++" "++lists:join($ ,Filelist)),
 1564:     {ok, Archive};
 1565: zip(ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1566:     ct:log("Creating zip:zip(~p,~n~p,~n~p)",[Archive, Filelist, Opts]),
 1567:     zip:zip(Archive, Filelist, Opts);
 1568: zip(emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1569:     ct:log("Creating emzip ~ts",[Archive]),
 1570:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts),
 1571:     {Files,_Cache} =
 1572:         lists:mapfoldl(
 1573:           fun F(Fn, Cache) ->
 1574:                   AbsFn = filename:join(Cwd, Fn),
 1575:                   {ok, Fi} = file:read_file_info(AbsFn),
 1576:                   {SubDirFiles, NewCache} =
 1577:                       if Fi#file_info.type == directory ->
 1578:                               {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(AbsFn),
 1579:                               lists:mapfoldl(F, Cache#{ Fn => <<>> },
 1580:                                              [filename:join(Fn, DirFn) || DirFn <- Files]);
 1581:                          Fi#file_info.type == regular ->
 1582:                               %% For this not to use a huge amount of memory we re-use
 1583:                               %% the binary for files that are links to the same file.
 1584:                               %% This cuts memory usage from ~16GB to ~4GB.
 1585:                               {[],
 1586:                                case file:read_link_all(AbsFn) of
 1587:                                   {ok, LinkFn} ->
 1588:                                       case maps:get(LinkFn, Cache, undefined) of
 1589:                                           undefined ->
 1590:                                               {ok, Data} = file:read_file(AbsFn),
 1591:                                               Cache#{ LinkFn => Data, Fn => Data };
 1592:                                           Data ->
 1593:                                               Cache#{ Fn => Data }
 1594:                                       end;
 1595:                                   {error, _} ->
 1596:                                       {ok, Data} = file:read_file(AbsFn),
 1597:                                       Cache#{ Fn => Data }
 1598:                               end}
 1599:                       end,
 1600:                   {[{Fn, maps:get(Fn, NewCache), Fi}|SubDirFiles], NewCache}
 1601:           end,  #{}, Filelist),
 1602:     zip:zip(Archive, lists:flatten(Files), proplists:delete(cwd,Opts)).
 1603: 
 1604: 
 1605: unzip(Config, Archive, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1606:     unzip(get_value(unzip, Config), Archive, Opts);
 1607: unzip(unzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1608:     UidGid = [" -X " || lists:member(uid_gid, get_value(extra, Opts, []))],
 1609:     Files = lists:join($ , get_value(file_list, Opts, [])),
 1610:     Res = cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1611:               "unzip "++UidGid++" "++Archive++" "++Files),
 1612:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1613:            lists:flatmap(
 1614:              fun(Ln) ->
 1615:                      case re:run(Ln, ~B'\s+[a-z]+: ([^\s]+)', [{capture,all_but_first,list},unicode]) of
 1616:                          nomatch -> [];
 1617:                          {match,Match} -> Match
 1618:                      end
 1619:              end,string:split(Res,"\n",all)))};
 1620: unzip(unezip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1621:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1622:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, Opts),
 1623:     {ok, lists:sort([F -- Cwd || F <- Files])};
 1624: unzip(unemzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1625:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1626:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, [memory | Opts]),
 1627:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1628:            [begin
 1629:                 case lists:last(F) of
 1630:                     $/ ->
 1631:                         filelib:ensure_path(F);
 1632:                     _ ->
 1633:                         filelib:ensure_dir(F),
 1634:                         file:write_file(F, B)
 1635:                 end,
 1636:                 F -- Cwd
 1637:             end || {F, B} <- Files])}.
 1638: 
 1639: cmp(Source, Target) ->
 1640:     {ok, SrcInfo} = file:read_file_info(Source),
 1641:     {ok, TgtInfo} = file:read_file_info(Target),
 1642:     ?assertEqual(SrcInfo#file_info.size, TgtInfo#file_info.size),
 1643:     ?assertEqual(SrcInfo#file_info.mode, TgtInfo#file_info.mode),
 1644: 
 1645:     {ok, Src} = file:open(Source, [read, binary]),
 1646:     {ok, Tgt} = file:open(Target, [read, binary]),
 1647: 
 1648:     cmp(Src, Tgt, 0),
 1649: 
 1650:     file:close(Src),
 1651:     file:close(Tgt).
 1652: 
 1653: %% Check if first 100 MB are the same
 1654: cmp(Src, Tgt, Pos) when Pos < 100 bsl 20 ->
 1655: 
 1656:     case {file:read(Src, 20 bsl 20), file:read(Tgt, 20 bsl 20)} of
 1657:         {{ok, Data}, {ok, Data}} ->
 1658:             cmp(Src, Tgt, Pos + 20 bsl 20);
 1659:         {E, E} ->
 1660:             ok
 1661:     end;
 1662: cmp(_Src, _Tgt, _) ->
 1663:     ok.
 1664: 
 1665: cmd(Cmd) ->
 1666:     Res = os:cmd(Cmd),
 1667:     ct:log("Cmd: ~ts~nRes: ~ts~n",[Cmd, Res]),
 1668:     Res.
 1669: 
 1670: disc_free(Path) ->
 1671:     Data = disksup:get_disk_data(),
 1672: 
 1673:     %% What partitions could Data be mounted on?
 1674:     Partitions =
 1675:         [D || {P, _Tot, _Perc}=D <- Data,
 1676:          lists:prefix(filename:nativename(P), filename:nativename(Path))],
 1677: 
 1678:     %% Sorting in descending order places the partition with the most specific
 1679:     %% path first.
 1680:     case lists:sort(fun erlang:'>='/2, Partitions) of
 1681:         [{_,Tot, Perc} | _] -> round(Tot * (1-(Perc/100)));
 1682:         [] -> error
 1683:     end.
 1684: 
 1685: memsize() ->
 1686:     case proplists:get_value(available_memory, memsup:get_system_memory_data()) of
 1687:         undefined ->
 1688:             {Tot,_Used,_}  = memsup:get_memory_data(),
 1689:             Tot;
 1690:         Available ->
 1691:             Available
 1692:     end.
